Chat_Check-In.author: Mike
Chat_Check-In.text:
I am happy to be welcomed in such a great team! 
Let us start our first digital retrospective!

Chat_Check-In.author: Mike
Chat_Check-In.text:
We will start with a short Check-In. 
Please describe the last sprint with a song title.

Chat_Check-In.author: Sandy
Chat_Check-In.text: Never Gonna Give You Up - Rick Astley

Chat_Check-In.author: Andrew
Chat_Check-In.text: They Want It, But No - Tobe Nwigwe

Chat_Check-In.author: Mike
Chat_Check-In.text:
Thank you all for your song ideas for the sprint! 
I will have to listen to all of them later :D 
...

Chat_Check-In.author: Mike
Chat_Check-In.text:
Let's move on to the main parts of our Retro :) 
Everyone, please write down 1-2 notes on what you were mad, sad or glad about in the last sprint.

Chat_Generate-Insights.author: Mike
Chat_Generate-Insights.text:
It seems like the increased occurence of bugs is our biggest problem. 
Why is that happening? 
Let's collect some ideas!

Chat_Generate-Insights.author: Aleyna
Chat_Generate-Insights.text: I think we have a lot of technical debt due to taking shortcuts when we had time-pressure before the last release.

Chat_Generate-Insights.author: Steve
Chat_Generate-Insights.text:
Yes, we should probably invest a few days to refactor some of the old code. 
Sandy, you have the best knowledge of our codebase, what do you think?

Chat_Generate-Insights.author: Sandy
Chat_Generate-Insights.text:
I agree that we need to do some refactoring. 
But we should also look at the cause. 
We are often too rushed to write clean and tested code. 
We could use more developers or reduce the tickets per sprint.

Chat_Generate-Insights.author: Andrew
Chat_Generate-Insights.text: What do you guys think of trying pair programming to catch more bugs in the future?
